result.execSummary:
The defendant Cary J Laper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cary J Laper is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cary J Laper was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.  Defendant is to re-pay the costs for Court Appointed Counsel - $574.00.  Court orders the monies on file ($340) be applied to the attorney fees.  On February 9, 2016 - Court determines an additional $133.00 for court appointed counsel.

Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  Court grants defendant sentence credit of 5 days if the defendant was held on this charge.  On January 8, 2016 the Court grants the defendant the 5 days of sentence credit.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
9:26 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Max Saylor.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  DA recites agreement - upon plea to count 1, will dismiss the repeater and counts 2 & 3.  Atty Saylor concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty count 1, striking the repeater and orders counts 2 & 3 be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Saylor.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-5 days county jail
-DL revocation - 12 months
-IID - 12 months
-Blood Draw Fee - $42.50
-AODA (Green Lake)
-Fine and costs totalling $1,379.00 - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

-Court orders defendant to re-pay the costs for court appointed attorney and orders the monies on file be applied to the attorney fees first and any balance applied to the fine and costs.

Court grants the defendant 5 days of sentence credit - if the defendant was held on this charge.

Court adjourned at 9:35 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-30-2015 09:00 am

9:09 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Max Saylor.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court makes statement regarding payment of court appointed attorney fees.  Statement by defendant, can pay $50.00 every 2 weeks.  Court amends order to:  defendant is to pay $50.00 every two weeks commencing 10/16 and every 2 weeks thereafter for court appointed counsel fees.  Statement by Atty Saylor.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing Hearing on November 30, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:10 a.m.
State's
Status hearing at 10-12-2015 09:00 am
to Atty Max Saylor with a copy of the criminal complaint, minutes and bail bond

to defendant - request for court appointed counsel has been approved.  Court appoints Atty Max Saylor to represent.  Defendant is to pay $140.00 per month commencing September 1, 2015 and the first of each month thereafter.
and Order - approved, signed by the judge
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Status hearing at 09-08-2015 10:00 am
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

8:56 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court will set for Status Hearing on September 8, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:59 a.m.
